org.gradoop.flink.model.api.epgm

Interface LogicalGraphOperators

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LogicalGraph

    public interface LogicalGraphOperators
    Defines the operators that are available on a LogicalGraph.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • cypher

        CAPFQueryResult cypher(String query,
                       MetaData metaData)
                throws Exception
        Evaluates the given cypher query using CAPF (Cypher for Apache Flink). CAPF implements the default cypher morphism strategies, which is vertex homomorphism and edge isomorphism. The result is a CAPFQueryResult, containing a flink table that can be converted to a GraphCollection, if it contains vertices or edges.
        Parameters:
        query - the query string
        metaData - metaData object
        Returns:
        the result, containing a flink table and possibly a GraphCollection
        Throws:
        Exception

      • cypher

        CAPFQueryResult cypher(String query)
                throws Exception
        Evaluates the given cypher query using CAPF (Cypher for Apache Flink). CAPF implements the default cypher morphism strategies, which is vertex homomorphism and edge isomorphism. The result is a CAPFQueryResult, containing a flink table that can be converted to a GraphCollection, if it contains vertices or edges.

        In this overloaded function, the property maps are constructed automatically. This is a lot slower and actually requires the job to be split in two parts to collect the property maps.

        Parameters:
        query - the query string
        Returns:
        the result, containing a flink table and possibly a GraphCollection
        Throws:
        Exception

      • query

        GraphCollection query(String query)
        Evaluates the given query using the Cypher query engine. The engine uses default morphism strategies, which is vertex homomorphism and edge isomorphism. The vertex and edge data of the data graph elements is attached to the resulting vertices.

        Note, that this method used no statistics about the data graph which may result in bad runtime performance. Use query(String, GraphStatistics) to provide statistics for the query planner.

        Parameters:
        query - Cypher query
        Returns:
        graph collection containing matching subgraphs

      • query

        GraphCollection query(String query,
                      String constructionPattern)
        Evaluates the given query using the Cypher query engine. The engine uses default morphism strategies, which is vertex homomorphism and edge isomorphism. The vertex and edge data of the data graph elements is attached to the resulting vertices.

        Note, that this method used no statistics about the data graph which may result in bad runtime performance. Use query(String, GraphStatistics) to provide statistics for the query planner.

        In addition, the operator can be supplied with a construction pattern allowing the creation of new graph elements based on variable bindings of the match pattern. Consider the following example: 

         graph.query(
  "MATCH (a:Author)-[:WROTE]->(:Paper)<-[:WROTE]-(b:Author) WHERE a <> b",
  "(a)-[:CO_AUTHOR]->(b)")

        The query pattern is looking for pairs of authors that worked on the same paper. The construction pattern defines a new edge of type CO_AUTHOR between the two entities.

        Parameters:
        query - Cypher query string
        constructionPattern - Construction pattern
        Returns:
        graph collection containing the output of the construct pattern

      • query

        GraphCollection query(String query,
                      GraphStatistics graphStatistics)
        Evaluates the given query using the Cypher query engine. The engine uses default morphism strategies, which is vertex homomorphism and edge isomorphism. The vertex and edge data of the data graph elements is attached to the resulting vertices.
        Parameters:
        query - Cypher query
        graphStatistics - statistics about the data graph
        Returns:
        graph collection containing matching subgraphs

      • query

        GraphCollection query(String query,
                      String constructionPattern,
                      GraphStatistics graphStatistics)
        Evaluates the given query using the Cypher query engine. The engine uses default morphism strategies, which is vertex homomorphism and edge isomorphism. The vertex and edge data of the data graph elements is attached to the resulting vertices.

        In addition, the operator can be supplied with a construction pattern allowing the creation of new graph elements based on variable bindings of the match pattern. Consider the following example: 

         graph.query(
  "MATCH (a:Author)-[:WROTE]->(:Paper)<-[:WROTE]-(b:Author) WHERE a <> b",
  "(a)-[:CO_AUTHOR]->(b)")

        The query pattern is looking for pairs of authors that worked on the same paper. The construction pattern defines a new edge of type CO_AUTHOR between the two entities.

        Parameters:
        query - Cypher query
        constructionPattern - Construction pattern
        graphStatistics - statistics about the data graph
        Returns:
        graph collection containing the output of the construct pattern

      • query

        GraphCollection query(String query,
                      boolean attachData,
                      MatchStrategy vertexStrategy,
                      MatchStrategy edgeStrategy,
                      GraphStatistics graphStatistics)
        Evaluates the given query using the Cypher query engine.
        Parameters:
        query - Cypher query
        attachData - attach original vertex and edge data to the result
        vertexStrategy - morphism setting for vertex mapping
        edgeStrategy - morphism setting for edge mapping
        graphStatistics - statistics about the data graph
        Returns:
        graph collection containing matching subgraphs

        GraphCollection query(String query,
                      String constructionPattern,
                      boolean attachData,

        query - Cypher query
        constructionPattern - Construction pattern
        attachData - attach original vertex and edge data to the result
        vertexStrategy - morphism setting for vertex mapping
        edgeStrategy - morphism setting for edge mapping
        graphStatistics - statistics about the data graph
        Returns:
        graph collection containing matching subgraphs

      • equalsByElementIds

        org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<Boolean> equalsByElementIds(LogicalGraph other)
        Checks, if another logical graph contains exactly the same vertices and edges (by id) as this graph.
        Parameters:
        other - other graph
        Returns:
        1-element dataset containing true, if equal by element ids

      • equalsByElementData

        org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<Boolean> equalsByElementData(LogicalGraph other)
        Checks, if another logical graph contains vertices and edges with the same attached data (i.e. label and properties) as this graph.
        Parameters:
        other - other graph
        Returns:
        1-element dataset containing true, iff equal by element data

      • equalsByData

        org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<Boolean> equalsByData(LogicalGraph other)
        Checks, if another logical graph has the same attached data and contains vertices and edges with the same attached data as this graph.
        Parameters:
        other - other graph
        Returns:
        1-element dataset containing true, iff equal by element data

      • groupVerticesByRollUp

        GraphCollection groupVerticesByRollUp(List<String> vertexGroupingKeys,
                                      List<AggregateFunction> vertexAggregateFunctions,
                                      List<String> edgeGroupingKeys,
                                      List<AggregateFunction> edgeAggregateFunctions)
        Generates all combinations of the supplied vertex grouping keys according to the definition of the rollUp operation in SQL and uses them together with all edge grouping keys for separate grouping operations. For example, specifying the vertex grouping keys A, B and C leads to three differently grouped graphs {A,B,C},{A,B},{A} within the resulting graph collection.
        Parameters:
        vertexGroupingKeys - grouping keys to group vertices
        vertexAggregateFunctions - aggregate functions to apply on super vertices
        edgeGroupingKeys - grouping keys to group edges
        edgeAggregateFunctions - aggregate functions to apply on super edges
        Returns:
        graph collection containing all resulting graphs

      • groupEdgesByRollUp

        GraphCollection groupEdgesByRollUp(List<String> vertexGroupingKeys,
                                   List<AggregateFunction> vertexAggregateFunctions,
                                   List<String> edgeGroupingKeys,
                                   List<AggregateFunction> edgeAggregateFunctions)
        Generates all combinations of the supplied edge grouping keys according to the definition of the rollUp operation in SQL and uses them together with all vertex grouping keys for separate grouping operations. For example, specifying the edge grouping keys A, B and C leads to three differently grouped graphs {A,B,C},{A,B},{A} within the resulting graph collection.
        Parameters:
        vertexGroupingKeys - grouping keys to group vertices
        vertexAggregateFunctions - aggregate functions to apply on super vertices
        edgeGroupingKeys - grouping keys to group edges
        edgeAggregateFunctions - aggregate functions to apply on super edges
        Returns:
        graph collection containing all resulting graphs

      • splitBy

        GraphCollection splitBy(String propertyKey)
        Splits the graph into multiple logical graphs using the property value which is assigned to the given property key. Vertices and edges that do not have this property will be removed from the resulting collection.
        Parameters:
        propertyKey - split property key
        Returns:
        graph collection

      • callForGraph

        LogicalGraph callForGraph(GraphsToGraphOperator operator,
                          LogicalGraph... otherGraphs)
        Creates a logical graph from that graph and other graphs using the given operator.
        Parameters:
        operator - multi graph to graph operator
        otherGraphs - other graphs
        Returns:
        result of given operator

      • callForCollection

        GraphCollection callForCollection(UnaryBaseGraphToBaseGraphCollectionOperator<LogicalGraph,GraphCollection> operator)
        Creates a graph collection from that graph using the given unary graph operator.
        Parameters:
        operator - unary graph to collection operator
        Returns:
        result of given operator

      • isEmpty

        org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<Boolean> isEmpty()
        Returns a 1-element dataset containing a boolean value which indicates if the graph is empty. A graph is considered empty, if it contains no vertices.
        Returns:
        1-element dataset containing true, if the collection is empty or false if not

      • writeTo

        void writeTo(DataSink dataSink)
      throws IOException
        Writes the graph to given data sink.
        Parameters:
        dataSink - The data sink to which the graph should be written.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the graph can't be written to the sink

      • writeTo

        void writeTo(DataSink dataSink,
             boolean overWrite)
      throws IOException
        Writes the graph to given data sink with an optional overwrite option.
        Parameters:
        dataSink - The data sink to which the graph should be written.
        overWrite - determines whether existing files are overwritten
        Throws:
        IOException - if the graph can't be written to the sink
